{"id":415364561,"lang":"cpp","time":"1 year, 5 months","timestamp":1604184911,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"44 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/415364561/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"58.4 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        \n        TreeNode* prev = nullptr;\n        TreeNode* last = nullptr;\n        TreeNode* first = nullptr;\n        function<void(TreeNode*, bool)> dfs = [&](TreeNode* cur, bool replace) -> void {\n            if (!cur) return;\n            \n            dfs(cur -> left, replace);\n            if (replace) {\n                if (!first && cur -> val > last -> val) {\n                    first = cur;\n                }\n            } else {\n                if (prev && cur -> val < prev -> val) {\n                    last = cur;\n                }\n                prev = cur;\n            }\n            dfs(cur -> right, replace);\n        };\n        \n        dfs(root, false);\n        dfs(root, true);\n        swap(last -> val, first -> val);\n        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree"}
